docstr:
`LNBLNK` â€” Index of the last non-blank character in a string ### Description Returns the length of a character string, ignoring any trailing blanks. This is identical to the standard `LEN_TRIM` intrinsic, and is only included for backwards compatibility. ### Syntax `RESULT = LNBLNK(STRING)` ### Arguments , with `INTENT(IN)`
### Return value The return value is of `INTEGER(kind=4)` type. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Elemental function ### See also INDEX intrinsic, LEN_TRIM
